result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J Abram was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Handling of a Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant to not to possess any firearms.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
dated October 11, 2016, from Br 3 to Ronald Abram, must work with attorney per request
Received October 6, 2016, dated Oct 3, 2016 from Ronald Abram, requesting release from further sessions with probation officer, filed with letter from Marie Abrm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ronald J Abram in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Criminal Complaint filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended charge. Court finds the defendant guilty of the amended charge: Negligent handling of a weapon.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Lutgen makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Withhold Sentence of:
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant Ronald J Abram in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ronald J Abram in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lutgen is waiting to see if the State has an offer.  Next hearing date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Marie A.   Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Ronald J Abram in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
